bibl.title: Moy Wah v. J. C. Drake. Subpoena
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington

div1.p: In the United States District Court for the District of Washington.
In re. Moy Wah Habeas Corpus
The President of the United States of America, To John Doe

YOU ARE HEREBY REQUIRED, That all and singular business and excuses being set aside, you appear and attend before the United States District Court for the Northern Division District of Washington, to be held at the Court Room of said Court, in the City of Seattle on the 12th day of June A.D. 1893, at ten o'clock a.M., then and there testify in the above entitled cause, now pending in said Court, on the part of the United States and you are not to depart the Court without the leave of the Court
And for a failure to attend, as above required, you will be deemed guilty of contempt of Court and liable to pay to the party aggrieved all loss and damage sustained thereby

WITNESS, the HON. C. H. HANFORD, Judge of the United States District Court for the District of Washington, and the seal of the said Court, this 8th day of June in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and Ninety- three and of our independence the one hundred and seventeenth
By E. V. Amery Deputy Clerk

I have served this writ personally by copy, on Charlie J Mulkey at Tacoma, Wash. Andrew Wasson At Port Towsend Wash. and I do hereby further certify that I am unable to find J. H. Cablenty.
this 12th day of June A.D. 1893.
